block.p: PENTECH INTERNATIONAL INC., Edison, N.J., a maker of pens and other writing and drawing instruments, said it had received an unsolicited bid of about $20 million from RoseArt Industries Inc., Livingston, N.J. Jakks Pacific Inc., Malibu, Calif., a toy maker, raised its bid to $1.60 a share from $1.40 to match RoseArt's offer.
SCANSOFT INC., Peabody, Mass., which makes software used to scan and edit photos, said it would cut 70 jobs to reduce costs.

APPLIED POWER INC., Waukesha, Wis., which provides electronics supplies and systems and industrial tools, components and systems, plans to spin off its APW Ltd. unit, which makes computer and electrical-equipment housings, and to change its own name to the Actuant Corp.

SYNCOR INTERNATIONAL CORP., Woodland Hills, Calif., a provider of high- technology health care services, plans to split its common stock two shares for one on Aug. 9 to shareholders of record July 26.
